info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 5 at 9:45AM CDT until June 10 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Sabine River Near Mineola affecting Wood and Smith Counties.
For the Sabine River...including Mineola...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sabine River near Mineola.
* WHEN...From Friday evening to Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Expect flooding of secondary roadways with picnic and recreational areas flooded as well. Also expect flooded boat ramps as well.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 14.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv
The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON
